summary: A reasonably spacious player home and farm on the road between the Guardian Stones and Riverwood.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-0-1507935003.jpg[/img][/center]


[size=3]A reasonably spacious player home and farm on the road between the Guardian Stones and Riverwood. This was originally just somewhere to try ideas (evil experiments) while learning the basics of CK and for messing about with some farming / survival mods. Soon I needed a home for myself, Vilja, a dog and a growing group of followers and children. Hence the creation of Greenmount Gardens.
[/size]
[color=#ffff00]
Note:[/color]

    This is my own personal play space and as such, should be considered a work in progress and is not yet complete or perfect.
    It is provided as is and may never be complete or perfect.
    NPC's and custom containers all use vanilla assets and as such their appearance may vary depending on what you have installed.
    This mod was built to use vanilla lighting and is only partially tuned for ENB.


[b][size=2][color=#00ff00]Greenmount Village Progress Report - v007  (2018-08-29)[/color]
[/size][/b]
[size=2]
* Prototype 007 is now online. I haven't got as much done as I would have liked, due to the death of a friend and updating other mods.

* The village name is now Kissojen laakso. Google assures me this is the correct Finnish translation for "Valley of the cats". (To honor my Finnish/Scandinavian ancestors.)

* Have added some more NPC's. They don't have AI packages yet and just sandbox at home.

* The Caclesh family now have a son.

* The herds have been added. I'm still fine tuning their flocking and semi-random patrol behaviors.

* Done some more work on some of the interiors. The rest have yet to be started.

[/size]* Have remade the lower village.  Unless there are any major issues with it, this is the [color=#ffff00]FINAL[/color] layout change. It is a blending of ideas we have been trying since before the first prototype was released. The middle pond has been replaced with a small creek. Things still need minor tweaking/smoothing. I'm liking the feel and flow of it a lot more now. FPS drop, for me, is less then the previous version. (50fps modded, 60fps vanilla) Time to move on to other things before I lose all self control and move it to a custom world... (Still a very tempting thought...)

* Have spent a fair bit of time reorganizing the meshes and textures into some form vaguely, resembling order. Mostly have the internals up to date. Just need to remake the scripts and associated stuff.

* Death Rabbit and Bunny Of Doom have been skinned alive. Despite their struggles and screams, they are now sporting new fur coats. Added some poultry and a few sheep. Started making AI for them today. Still a lot more to do. If only we could get the ducks to float rather than walking along the bottom of the pond...

* Aeridi has crafted 2 teleport gems. They are on the table in the main home's crafting area. At the moment, activating either from your inventory will take you to an alternate world space. Activating either again will send you back. Have only done some quick tests for now. Hopefully, they will work to and from any location.

* Still trying to get the right look for Talinne. (She now looks a lot like an old childhood friend of mine.) Added Niall's twin girls to the game. They are fully custom and will only wear the clothes in their inventories. They will equip adult clothes and keep the perks. But, will appear naked. (Different body slots for children and adults.) They still need some more work.

[size=2]* Am looking for some good "free to use" Argonian and Khajiit textures. As well as "free to use" underwear for the younger NPCs. (Non sexy/skimpy.) All suggestions are welcome.

* Please feel free to share your suggestions, tips and wishes. I seriously consider all feedback. Although, I may not be able to make it into reality. I'll give it a go.[/size]


[b][size=2][color=#00ff00]Script Tutorial

[/color][/size][/b]Kriemen's Script Tutorial is complete and now resides on its own mod page. 



[u][color=#00ff00][b][center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-3-1507935003.jpg[/img][/center][/b][/color][/u]


[list]
[*][size=2]4 Residents who can become companions[/size]
[*][size=2]A Bard/companion, who performs each evening[/size]
[*]Alchemy/Enchanting area with custom bookcases and storage
[*][size=2]Cooking area with oven and working churn.[/size]
[/list]
[list]
[*][size=2]Many custom containers for ingredients, potions, food and drink.[/size]
[*][size=2]Many safe storage barrels (Light brown ones)[/size]
[*][size=2]Some re-spawning barrels (Grey ones)[/size]
[*][size=2]Plenty of room for companions and pets[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Separate Main bedroom with double bed[/size]
[*][size=2]Bedroom space for up tp 6 adopted children (HF vers)[/size]
[*][size=2]Bedrooms with beds for up tp 10 companions/guests[/size]
[*][size=2]Bathing area with auto undress/redress (Not quite perfect yet. Still working on it...)[/size]
[*][size=2]Small armory with mannequins, weapon/shield plaques and racks. (For those of us who collect rare weapons and armors)[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Can now place daggers on the tables in the armory[/size]
[*][size=2]A room to display one's treasures and collectables[/size]
[*][size=2]A configuration room, allowing the player to toggle various features[/size]
[*][size=2]Some interactive, mounted, animal heads[/size]
[/list]

[center]
[b][u][color=#00ff00][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-2-1507935003.jpg[/img][/color][/u][/b][/center][b][u][color=#00ff00]
[/color][/u][/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]2 New patrol guards/companions (Old friends of Ulf)[/size]
[*][size=2]Alchemy garden with 28 Hearthfires planters[/size]
[*][size=2]Lots of landscape and garden work[/size]
[*][size=2]A quiet fishing spot[/size]
[*][size=2]Quiet places to just sit and relax[/size]
[*][size=2]Crafting area[/size]
[*][size=2]Smelter (behind Ulf's cottage)                                    [/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Party area for locals to relax on weekends[/size]
[*][size=2]Small pond with fish and fed by a spring[/size]
[*][size=2]Cows, goats and chickens[/size]
[*][size=2]Vegetable garden[/size]
[*][size=2]Jethro, the horse[/size]
[*][size=2]A pair of guard bunnies[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]NPC's, horse and bunnies have their own routines in and around Riverwood[/size]
[*][size=2]Horse and bunnies return to the stables at night and when it's raining[/size]
[*][size=2]Many Riverwood residents visit the gardens at various times[/size]
[*][size=2](I have seen Dorthe and Frodnar join in games with adopted children)[/size]

[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Some safe storage barrels (Light colored ones)[/size]
[*][size=2]Some re-spawning barrels   (Grey ones)[/size]
[*][size=2]And lot's more landscape work...[/size]
[/list]


[color=#00ff00][center][color=#00ff00][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-5-1507935003.jpg[/img][/color][/center]
[/color]

The following features can be toggled at any time, to suit yourself
The controls are located in the gallery, via the armory
For older vers look inside the wardrobe in the main bedroom for the controls.

[list]
[*][size=2]  Individual NPC's[/size]
[*][size=2]  Shirene's bard ability[/size]
[*][size=2]  Smelter area[/size]
[*][size=2]  Vegetable garden[/size]
[*][size=2]  Alchemy Garden[/size]
[*][size=2]  Extra trees[/size]
[*][size=2]  Extra plants[/size]
[*][size=2]  Companions bedroom (3 beds)[/size]
[*][size=2]  Children's bedroom (3 beds)[/size]
[*][size=2]  Extended childrens bedroom (3 beds)[/size]
[*][size=2]  3 Mannequins in the main hall (armory is untouched)[/size]
[/list][size=2]

[/size][color=#ffff00]Notes:[/color]

       Mannequins and NPC's are teleported to a holding cell. This way their inventories will stay intact.
       If an NPC is a follower, you can call them back from the holding cell. (Tested with Follower Mod)
       Mannequins will unequip their armour when re-enabled and generally face the wrong direction.
       To reset them, just go to an outside cell and return, or manually add/remove something from them.
      
       If you toggle the children's beds, please remember to recast "Bless Home" spell.
       That will allow "Hearthfires Multiple Adoptions" to sense how many beds are available.

       In my testing, the containers in the smelter area have kept their contents, even after being toggled several times.
       If you don't trust them, just stash your loot elsewhere before disabling them.

       Please remember to pick and clear all plants from the Hearthfires planters before toggling them. Otherwise
       there will be a lot of floating plants in the Alchemy garden.

       Have added 3 custom bookcases. I've tried hard to get an "everyday used" feel with them. Some are angled so the havok
       will lay them in the correct direction. If the books don't fall corrctly, just activate the bookcase and exit.
       DO NOT remove books without activating the book case. The counters mess up and books tend disappear into the realms of 
       Oblivion. This causes Urag to get quite upset.

[u][color=#00ff00]
[/color][/u][center][/center][center][/center][center][/center]
[center][/center][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-1-1507937467.jpg[/img]


[list]
[*][size=2][b]Elissa - [/b]Bow, 1H weapons. Light armor[/size]
[*][size=2][b]Ulf[/b] - Bow, 1H weapons and light armor[/size]
[*][size=2][b]Aeridi [/b]- Conjuration, Necromancy, 1H weapons. Any armor[/size]
[*][size=2][b]Jenlling [/b]- Any weapon or armor[/size]
[*][size=2][b]Bella[/b] - Conjuration, Shock and 1H weapon. Light armor.[/size]
[*][size=2][b]Hlenthis[/b] - 2H weapons. Light armor.[/size]
[*][size=2][b]Shirene[/b] - Restoration, Destruction and 1H weapon. Light armor. (Will try to keep the team's health up)[/size]
[/list][size=2]

[color=#ffff00]Notes:[/color]

           Residents are essential and can be wed.
           Female residents are now standalone and their appearance shouldn't be affected by other mods.
           Male residents heads are now standalone, but their body type will be whatever you have installed.

           Please be gentle, as I've never tried making one before. Or 7 of them, as is the case here.
           (They are the best I can do, with my limited knowledge of the process...)


[color=#ffff00]Customise to your own liking[/color]

Males use whatever body you have installed.
Female body type is [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35748/?]UNPetite by Nightasy[/url]
Female body textures are [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35267/?]SG Female Textures Renewal by Hello Santa[/url]

To change body types or textures just replace what you want, keeping the names used in the following directories.
You may wish to extract the BSA to do this of simply load them loose AFTER GMG

Face Meshes
\meshes\actors\character\facegendata\facegeom\gmg.esp
\textures\actors\character\facegendata\facetint\gmg.esp

Shared Body Female
\meshes\GMGNPCs\Shared Body
\textures\GMGNPCs\Shared Body

Individual NPC parts, eyes, hair etc
\meshes\GMGNPCs\NPCNAME
\textures\GMGNPCs\NPCNAME

Shared Body Male
\meshes\GMGNPCs\Shared Male Body
\textures\GMGNPCs\Shared Male Body


[color=#ffff00]Height and Weight[/color]

If you wish to change either of these, select the NPC in the console and
use the following commands in this order...


setnpcweight x       (where x=0 to 100)
setscale y                (where y<1 for smaller, y>1 for taller)
disable
enable                      (This will reset the ugly potato head)[/size]


[center]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-8-1507935003.jpg[/img][/center]


Greenmount Gardens now comes in 3 flavours.


[color=#ffff00]No DLC[/color]     
  
   Does not need anything. 
   Can not adopt. Can not display treasures.

[color=#ffff00]All DLC[/color]     

   Needs Hearthfires, Dragonborn and Dawnguard DLC. 
   Can Adopt. Can not display treasures.

   [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29249]Heartfire Multiple Adoptions by TMPhoenix[/url] is needed, if you wish to adopt children.
   Just use the "Bless Home" spell when indoors, to enable support.
   Skyrim runs without it, but adoptions in custom homes won't work.

[color=#ffff00]Treasures[/color] 

   Needs Hearthfires, Dragonborn and Dawnguard DLC.
   Can Adopt. Can display treasures.
            
   [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32550/?]General Displays by Tueffel[/url] is required to display your treasures.
   Please make sure that GeneralDisplays.esm, GeneralDisplays-DB.esm and GeneralDisplays-DG.esm
   are enabled and loaded BEFORE GMG.esp Otherwise, the game will crash on start.
  
   I used this so your treasures can be accessed and displayed simultaneously in any homes that have the activators.
   Just add and remove your treasures from the safe and they should be displayed after a few secounds.
   It has a few little quirks, so, treat it like the custom bookshelfs.


[color=#ffff00]GMG and ETaC[/color] 

  GMGETaC - Complete does not require any DLC.
  If you get CTD on startup, place GMG and GMGETaC [color=#ffff00]last[/color] in your load order.
  If you have mods that change the appearance of Riverwood NPCs, load them [color=#ffff00]after[/color] GMG and GMGETaC.


[color=#ffff00][size=3]Kriemen's Riverwood is done and can be found [url=https://rd.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88699]here[/url][/size][/color]



[center]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-7-1507935003.jpg[/img][/center]


[color=#ffff00]NOTE:[/color] GMG0100HF is not compatible with any earlier versions.

[color=#ffff00]   1[/color] - Create a new save. (keep your old one safe)
[color=#ffff00]   2[/color] - Just place GMG.esp and GMG.bsa into skyrim\data
[color=#ffff00]   3[/color] - Enjoy...

If this is not to your liking, simply remove any stashed loot, delete GMG.esp, GMG.bsa and the new save.

Or (better still)

Open it in Creation Kit and hack it about until your heart's content. Have fun with it and learn CK at the same time. [grin]
Anything I've diddled / created has the prefix GMG and does not overwrite any vanilla objects.
If you release a mod based on this, let me know and I'll make a link to it.
[center]


[color=orange][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-1-1507935003.jpg[/img][/color][/center]


Any mod that changes the following may conflict. [X/Idle Markers]

[list]
[*][size=2]  Area between the Riverwood guards camp and Embershard Mine rear entrance            [Main residence/landscaping][/size]
[*][size=2]  Area next to the large waterfalls downstream of Riverwood. Where the wolves attack.[/size]
[*][size=2]  Area around the Guardian Stones.[/size]
[*][size=2]  Area between Riverwood sawmill and workbench.[/size]
[*][size=2]  Area near Alvor's forge.[/size]
[*][size=2]  Interior of Riverwood Trader.[/size]
[*][size=2]  Interior of Sleeping Giant Inn.[/size]
[*][size=2]  AI packages for Alvor, Sigrid, Hod, Gerdur, Faendal, Hilde (Base AI is unchanged, but have added packages to allow interactions with GMG)[/size]
[*][size=2]  Beautification of the above NPC's. Load these AFTER GMG (Even though I've only edited AI packages, CK also adds other data as well)[/size]
[/list]
This mod was built to use vanilla lighting and is only partially tuned for ENBs. Some areas may be a tad dark or too bright. Please read the included "ENB Notes.txt"

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13608/?]Expanded Towns and Cities by missjennabee[/url] 
Just select the appropriate patch located in the options download section.

Load in this order
   ETaC
  GMG
  GMGETaC patch

If you get an infinite load screen on startup, place the patch at the end of your load order.

Towns and Villages Enhanced - Riverwood by Aplestormy  
  Load BEFORE Greenmount Gardens and manually disable 3 trees in the crafting area.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/15878/?]Hunters Cabin of Riverwood by Okiir[/url] Major coverlap.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18878/?]Hunters Cabin Of Riverwood V2 by Crack23[/url] Major overlap



[center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/49220-4-1507935003.jpg[/img][/center]

or similar. Without this NPC's can look a bit rough.

Use My Home Is Your Home or similar to have companions live at Greenmount.

I don't know how "lore friendly" these are, but they do add more life to the area.

[center]
